summary: This bill, the Southcentral Foundation Land Transfer Act of 2025, mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to transfer approximately 3.372 acres of land in Anchorage, Alaska to the Southcentral Foundation (SCF), a healthcare provider, within two years of the Act's enactment. The transfer is to be done via a warranty deed, with no financial consideration or conditions imposed on SCF. The bill also addresses environmental liability, protecting SCF from pre-existing contamination on the property and requiring the Secretary to comply with environmental regulations. This act aims to support SCF's health and social services programs.
